place.name: BANHAM
place.gazetteerText: BANHAM, a parish and a subdistrict, in the district of Guiltcross, Norfolk. The parish lies 2½ miles SW of New Buckenham, and 4 E of Eccles Road r. station; and has a post office under Attleborough. Acres, 3,963. Real property, £8,131. Pop., 1,163. Houses, 253. The property is much subdivided. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £1,000.* Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is good; and there are two Methodist chapels, a national school, and charities, £136.-The subdistrict contains eight parishes. Acres, 18,681. Pop., 5,516. Houses, 1,243. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
